name: Hilton Munich City

reviews.title: Great Property, well appointed rooms and very centrally located.
reviews.text: Hilton City Centre is one of the best hotels in Munich with very well appointed rooms, great cafe and breakfast service and cordial staff.

reviews.title: Very convenient location from airport and to main tourist attractions
reviews.text: The location of property is very central in Rosenheimer Platz Strasse and is connected to S Bahn directly.

reviews.title: It's a hotel, it's clean, but that's it
reviews.text: The property is very well mainitained and is a value for money. It can be reached by S Bahn on Metro and by Taxi also. Overall this is one of the best property in town.

reviews.title: Tiptop!
reviews.text: I recently stayed two nights at the Hilton Munich city. After a long flight from the US, I was able to check in very early (around 11:00) as a Gold Hhonors member I was upgraded to a club floor with free access to snacks, drinks and breakfast. This was a nice and very convenient perk. The staff was friendly and helpful, and overall it's hard to find any major faults in the hotel.

reviews.title: Great business hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is located directly above the Rosenheimer Platz S bahn station, so it's especially convenient if you are going to/from the airport or if you want to go to Marienplatz (2 stops away).

reviews.title: Horrible!
reviews.text: For being a 4 start hotel, I cannot believe this is one of the worst Hilton we have ever been! We spent almost 2 times the price on this hotel because it was a German holiday/October fest weekend. For the price it was totally NOT WORTH it! With any Hilton brand, one thing that defines them above every other hotel is their attention to details and this is what we expect! The hotel room's wall paper was peeling off; there was spider web on the ceiling/walls. The coffee/tea container was dirty and had someone's hair clip left in it. Worst thing was when we took a shower, the smell of rotten, moldy water with the combination of steam made the bathroom smell horrible. Like I mentioned above, I would expect this at a 3 star hotel, not at Hilton.

reviews.title: Typical Hilton 3 1/2 stars
reviews.text: The good:

reviews.title: Clean business hotel - good for leisure as well
reviews.text: Check in was easy, only waited 15 minutes at the front desk. We booked a King Executive Plus room on the top floor with a garden view. Everything looked the same as in the pictures. The room was clean and houskeeping service was fantastic. The Executive Lounge was nice for breakfast and after dinner drinks. The location of the hotel is very convenient.

reviews.title: Uncharacteristically disappointing
reviews.text: The bad:

reviews.title: Hilton Munich City
reviews.text: After waiting 15 minutes to check in, the person at the front desk tells us that since we're on the Executive floor we should check in at the Executive concierge lounge. Why would we do that after waiting?

reviews.title: Friendly staff
reviews.text: Nice hotel , friendly staff.

reviews.title: Very good Hilton hotel
reviews.text: The terrible coffee in foyer cafe was the only negative.

reviews.title: Easy Fixes
reviews.text: It is located few steps from subway station Rosenheimer Strasse. The hotel have an exit right at the station. You can easy reach the center of the city by subway or by foot. The walk distance is 20-25 minutes. The Deutsches Museum is near the hotel.

reviews.title: Great business hotel
reviews.text: Rooms are standard hilton's high quality - spacious and clean. The bathroom is perfect.

reviews.title: Huge, lovely room and convienent location
reviews.text: There were too many people in the hotel during our stay. At the check-out I was disappointed seeing a bill from the laundry. But I didn't use the laundry service. In the next 5 minutes the problem was resolved, but annoyance is remained.

reviews.title: Nice vibe
reviews.text: We didn't stay here as we were in the Holiday inn across the road. We did visit to sample 'the tapas menu' in the lounge bar - super!!

reviews.title: Nice location - but too expensive!
reviews.text: compared to the Holiday inn the food was better and the place had a better 'vibe' to it.

reviews.title: Ok rooms, very expensive
reviews.text: For over 400 Euro a night you should throw in wifi AND breakfast, something that is standard in most European hotels. The staff was nice enough and the location is very convenient, but this hotel was way too expensive for what you got.

reviews.title: Oktoberfest convenience
reviews.text: Spent 3 days here for Oktoberfest last weekend and not sure I would use this hotel again. Rooms were fine, staff were professional, not really friendly, breakfast was terrible, except for the egg station. Location was good, above the subway station. But for the price I expected much better. Also, this is another hotel where cleaning staff want to just barge into your room, 3 times last Saturday morning, with the first time being 715am. Wouldn't have been so bad if I hadn't of just made it to bed 2 hrs before! Good luck trying to print a boarding pass, went to the executive lounge and had to wait 30 mins for people in line for the 1 computer. The lounge attendant said she couldn't do it from her computer. I don't complain much about hotels but I won't be back to this location. I have had much better experiences at Hampton Inns.

reviews.title: Perfect location, great hotel
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Hilton Munich for Oktoberfest. The location was great and the hotel had all the regular amenities you can expect from a Hilton. Having executive lounge access because of our status was a definite plus. The staff were generally very helpful despite the busy period, minus one exception. We did have a few disturbances from other guests that had too much to drink. The air conditioner in the room didn't seem to work well, so sleeping was a bit uncomfortable. It was an overall good stay, though.

description: The Hilton Munich City provides modern accomodation in the heart of Munich, with a direct train link to the aiport and the main station. The shopping mile at the Marienplatz ist just a ten minutes walk away. Business centre, 2 restaurants, café, bar, 24h gym, room service - the hotel offers the full range of services for the business and leisure guest.
